headline: Grilled Asian Chicken
description: Asian chicken flavored with a delicious combo of soy, sesame, ginger, garlic, and honey. The marinade creates a delicious glaze on grilled chicken.
name: Grilled Asian Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Combine soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger in a small microwave-safe bowl; heat in the microwave on medium power for 1 minute, then stir. Heat again for 30 seconds, watching closely to prevent boiling.
Place chicken breasts in a shallow dish. Pour soy sauce mixture over top and set aside to marinate for 15 minutes.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Meanwhile, remove chicken from marinade; transfer marinade into a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until thick, about 1 minute. Set aside for basting.

Cook chicken on the preheated grill, basting frequently with reserved marinade, until golden brown on all sides and chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 6 to 8 minutes per side. An instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the thickest piece should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: So delicious! I threw in several breakfast pork chops since I only had 2 chicken breasts. I marinated the meat a bit longer than what the recipe called for (I long a more pronounced flavor) and grilled it to my liking. Paired this with a lo mein noodle recipe from this website. We are all stuffed!!!
Too much soya sauce flavour

My family liked it. On the grill I had to cook it for about 20 minutes at 350 (tempted dropped with basting). I scaled back the sesame oil because my family isn't a fan. I used about a 1 tsp. Duck sauce paired perfectly with it. Definitely try to use low sodium soy sauce if you can. I used regular soy sauce and there were a few bites I felt it was to much. Thanks for sharing the recipe
One of our favorite marinades!
My husband is fussy when it comes to reciepes but loved this one and i also enjoyed it also thank you.
This turned out amazing. Didn’t have time to cook it after marinating it for 5 hours so just cooked it the next night on the grill. SO. . GOOD.
Was perfect for a protein to go with an Asian sesame salad for the family.

Great recipe! I I did let it sit for 6 hrs, to get more of the great flavor. Don’t need a lot of ingredients which is nice. I didn’t have fresh ginger, so I used 1 tsp of dried ginger. Also, I didn’t put the remaining marinade to boil before I basted because I didn’t think it was necessary since there wasn’t any cornstarch in it. It still was yummy ! Served with rice and asparagus.
I really enjoyed the Grilled Asian Chicken. I will definitely be making this again!
I didn’t have breasts so I made it with chicken thighs… no other changes!!!! Absolutely delicious! Thank you!

This recipe was excellent! I'm assuming the honey was in the recipe to help brown the chicken, because I couldn't taste it.
Also, I had no fresh garlic or ginger on hand, so I used dried. Amazing! I'm sure it will taste even better with fresh ingredients.
I used bone-in chicken thighs that I left marinating for two hours, so the grill/cook time had to be adjusted for that.
This was a delicious recipe that I will make again.
I used brown sugar instead of Honey. It tasted good still.

After tasting the marinade, made as directed, I added more honey to balance out the saltiness of the soy sauce. Marinated chicken breasts and thighs for 10 hours then grilled. Very tasty. Would make it again.

Love this marinade! Perfect for a quick weekday dinner with rice and a salad. Only thing I did differently was to blend the marinade to help intensify the ginger garlic flavor. Sometimes add Sambal to add a little kick.
My husband loved it. We will definitely make it again with few adjustments.
goood taste just my grill cooked to long and fast.

Mmmm so good!
Easy and fast too!
We paired with an Asian salad and green beans with rice on the side.
Definitely a new staple in our rotation. Thank you!
Easy & delicious!!!!!
i used a sesame and garlic glaze and instead of the sesame oil and did not need to heat it up. it was delicious!
I added a little bit of rice wine vinegar and it came out so juicy and delicious!

Terrific chicken! I minced the ginger instead of adding then removing slices. I marinated the chicken in the fridge for a couple of hours then baked it in the sauce turning halfway through the cooking. 
#AllrecipesAllstarsCanada
#lunarnewyear
Really yummy and moist!

This is okay. As written the marinating time really does nothing. It was missing something to me...not exactly sure what. 
I recommend marinating for at least 4 or 6 hours.

I baked the chicken in the oven at 400 for 35 minutes.

Next time I will cube the chicken then marinate it for longer and cook it on the stove top.

I thought it was really good, but I think it lacked green onion. I think green onion would have added just the right touch of flavor. I did thicken the sauce with just a bit of cornstarch, and that was a great touch. Overall, this was a really good dish and I'll make it again with green onion next time! Thank you!

I thought this was outstanding. I followed the marianade ingredients exactly, however, placed chicken in the marinade for a couple of hours instead of the 10 minutes. This chicken was heavenly. I served with Asian noodles posted by another member on this site.
Enjoyed this simple dish. I baked the chicken rather than grilling it. I will make this again.
I added hoisin, oyster sauce, red wine vinegar, and sriracha (to taste). Wonderful additions!
Very good recipe as given. Flavors go well together. As usual, I did double some of the ingredients, bug that is personal preference.

This is my go-to marinade for Asian-style chicken. I make the marinade as directed and marinate chicken thighs for 48 hours before freezing. When it's time to make them, I just thaw and grill. It's as good as going to a restaurant!

TIP: Make a little extra marinade to drizzle over the cooked chicken & rice -- you won't be sorry you did!
I thought it was very simple and had really nice flavor. Will make it again

Instead of using this as a marinade, I used it as a sauce to coat cooked chicken to make rice bowls. I doubled the recipe in a saucepan, then let it come to simmer and added a few teaspoons of cornstarch and whisked until thickened. I poured over cooked chicken chunks and topped with sesame seeds. Very very good.
Easy and tasty! Tired of typical BBQ chicken and this is a great summer BBQ chicken alternative!

This is going on the "once a week list". We couldn't be happier with how good this is. I followed recipe exactly except for using organic low sodium tamari instead of regular soy and powdered ginger in stead of fresh, and did not heat the marinade. I made marinade, put in ziploc bag with chicken and marinated in fridge a few hours. I made a second batch of marinade (half amount) to use when grilling (did not heat marinade before). I followed advice of another reviewer and pounded the chicken breasts flat. We used free range organic 2.5 pounds. It took 5 minutes or less per side to cook. Served over rice. WOW
This is a family favorite! Love it!

This was an excellent recipe! I made as written, except that I used 1 T. of minced ginger instead of slices of ginger. I always mince ginger and garlic ahead of time and freeze it, so thats what I had on hand. I will certainly keep this yummy, simple and very easy recipe in our normal circulation.

This was delicious! I did do two things differently, but don't think that would really change the outcome too much. I didn't have fresh ginger so I used a teaspoon of ginger powder. I also marinated it overnight because no one came home for dinner the first night so I just let it sit in the fridge overnight. 

I pounded out the chicken breasts so they wouldn't take long to cook on the grill. Grilled maybe 6 minutes on each side and basted only one time. This was very flavorful and juicy.

OMG! This marinade was amazing! I didn't bother heating up the ingredients. I just mixed them all together and poured it over the chicken. I didn't have enough sesame oil so added canola oil for the remainder of the oil called for. I didn't have ginger root so used 2 teaspoons of the ginger that comes in a tube (found in the fresh produce section). Will be making this again, that's for sure! Thanks for posting. Can bake at 400 for 40-45 min, covered. Next time I'll try uncovered as sauce was thin.

I made exactly as the recipe called for. Marinated only 15 minutes. My husband loved it. The chicken was very tender, however, (I knew you were waiting for a however), I thought the sesame oil overpowered the chicken. I would make again, but probably cut back on the sesame oil. I would cut in half,but that is me. To each his own. Will make again. Have fun and enjoy!!!!!
I used liquid aminos instead of soy sauce and reduced the amount, as it's very salty and it tasted great!
I thought it was ok.

Great marinade! Used boneless/skinless chicken thighs instead of breast since I already had those on hand and decided to marinate over night for more flavor. Works wonderful topped with green onions with a side of fried rice.
Marinaded for several hours instead of 15 minutes, otherwise followed the recipe more or less exactly. Tastes great and not too hard to make, would definitely recommend.

This was a delicious recipe. Let me start off by saying I'm not the best cook in the world and this recipe made me look like a pro! Haha. This was a last minute decision lunch so I only made 1 serving and adjusted the ingredients accordingly. I added a tsp of sugar and some red pepper flakes for a kick. I also put the chicken in a bag and marinaded for only one hour because I was low on time. Being marinaded for only an hour, it was still so flavorful and juicy. This will definitely be my go to for marinating chicken!
I used ground ginger instead of fresh because I'm broke and have to use what I already have in house lol. I used 1/2 tsp and everyone loved it!
I made it and it's amazing
When the husband says "this is a keeper" you know it's good. Just signed up for All Recipes because of this little ditty! I marinaded about 8 hours instead end of the suggested 15 minutes.

Loved this! I used extra garlic because we love it, and marinated for two hours. I used bone-in chicken thighs. I used the extra sauce to drizzle over the chicken and served it with rice. A great weeknight meal!
I followed this recipe exactly, and it was perfect!! It's the best Asian chicken marinade I ever had!

4.5 Stars: I heated the marinade and marinated the meat overnight. I put three deep cuts in each breast so the marinade gets in better. I boiled the marinade, baked the chicken and basted. The flavor was good.

Realized at the last minute that I needed a quick marinade for the chicken I was about to grill for my salad tonight. Found this and figured it was quick and easy so why not give it a shot. Boy am I glad I did. Removed the tenders from the breasts and pounded the breasts nice and even then butterflied them and marinated at room temp for approx 20 minutes. They only took about 4-5 minutes per side on the grill and turned out fantastic. Next time I make this I will double the marinade and thicken it to serve as a sauce. Definite keeper.
This was awesome!! I forgot to buy sesame oil, so I substituted with olive oil, and this was just delicious. The whole family loved it.
everyone loved this recipe and makes great leftovers

Just whipped this up tonight for dinner with some asparagus and jasmine rice. It was VERY flavorful, and with a relatively small ingredients list, it's an economical dinner as well for those working with a small grocery budget. I chose to cut three large chicken breasts in to smaller 1 1/2 inch strips in order to reduce the cooking time and get a more intense marinade soak that penetrateed the entire piece of chicken. I'll be making this dish again :)

I was looking for an easy delicious recipe tonight with ingredients I had. This was a perfect choice. I followed the recipe mostly. I doubled the sauce, I only had teriyaki sauce, and I added dried onion flakes. I used my George Forman grill, and just tossed the chicken in the left over sauce afterwards. My little kids and husband went back for seconds. My kids kept saying how good it was. With it I made Jasmine rice and turned it into a simple fried rice with onion sauteed in sesame oil and 2 scrambled eggs. I will definitely be making this again and again. Thank you.

I've used this recipe almost weekly since I found it. My entire family loves it. I've replaced ginger root for powdered ginger at time when I did not have any ginger root and it still turned out very well. I've served this with rice, noodles and have even made salads with chicken and broccoli slaw. This recipe is quick and easy to make. I usually don't heat the marinade either.

Yum! I followed the recipe exactly regarding the ingredients. However, I marinated all day and then baked it in the marinade. I served this with Chinese Chicken Fried Rice II from this site and steamed broccoli. DH mixed everything together in a bowl.
Good, but will make with olive oil as we were not crazy of the sesame oil flavor.

I liked that the chicken did not need to marinade all day, so, I thought I would give this recipe a try. It was ok, but, nothing special. It seemed slightly bitter and salty to me. It didn't seemed to have a great balance of flavor for us. There are so many really good Asian marinade recipes out there that I don't think I will be making this again.
too salty and the flavors seemed overwhelmed by the soy sauce.

My family raved about this one. For 6 chicken breasts, I doubled the recipe. For the ginger, I used 3 Tbsp of jarred minced ginger and 2 tsp of jarred minced garlic. 

I didn't cook anything; I just mixed the ingredients well and poured over the chicken in a ziplock bag and let sit for about 20 hours.
Very good flavor! May marinate overnight to enhance flavor as some pieces had less flavor. Used ginger paste to make things simple.

Easy, delicious and made with ingredients I keep on hand. For easy cleanup, I marinated the chicken in a sealed plastic bag. I may double the marinade next time so I have more sauce for rice. Do be sure to boil the marinade though, to make it safe to eat after it's had raw chicken in it.
Too bland, will not use this one again.
Loved the flavors!
good. not great.
Such an easy and tasty sauce. No fuss no muss! Liked it for when I don't have a lot of time.
I used a toasted sesame oil, and even though I thought that it tasted awfully sesame oil like when I tried it by itself, on the chicken it was great! My picky boyfriend loved it!
On of the best! Amazing recipe. I let the chicken marinate till we were ready to grill about 1 hour. So good.

I marinated this overnight and grilled it the next day. I doubled the marinade, took out the chicken and boiled the marinade to use as a basting/ dipping sauce. I tasted the sauce and thought it was too sweet so I added some white vinegar and siracha sauce until I liked the spiciness, so when you bite into the chicken first you get the spicy sauce then the sweet and tender chicken

Good. I grilled pineapple at the same time. Nice addition. Don't do the microwave bit tho'. Add'n. of lime juice to marinade gives it a bit of zing. Depends on what you have in the fridge I suppose. I'm always in favour of using what's on hand.

Awesome, easy & authentic tasting! I combined the ingredients & simply marinated the chicken. There isn't a need to cook the marinade before adding the meat. 
I used chicken thighs & garnished them with sesame seeds & green onions. 
I think this marinade would go well with any meat, including beef & salmon.
This was really good! I only marinated the chicken for an hour and I thought it might not have much flavour, but it was delicious! So easy.

This is a very good marinade that’s easy to prepare and flavorful. I cut my chicken breasts into medallions and pounded them to a uniform thickness. I marinated them for an hour and a half but would add additional time the next time. Unfortunately, because of a severe storm, I was unable to grill them but they came out wonderfully in my cast iron skillet. Everyone enjoyed them.

Well I can't follow directions and skipped the microwave step and went straight to the marinade step, but this turned out fine. The soy was a bit strong and maybe teriaki sauce would be better next time even though I used a low sodium soy sauce. I used powdered ginger and only 1 tsp. It could have used more though as I really like ginger. I used a packaged asian salad mix and then sliced this grilled chicken and placed it on top and this was as fancy and plate pretty as something you would get when dining out. I'd like sesame seeds added next time too, and maybe even some chives or green onion.
Love this! Easy and always a hit! Thanks for sharing
Yummy. I thought it was a little on the salty side,but still good overall. Perhaps I basted too much...
I followed the recipe and just did`nt get the taste or flavor that I thought I would. Next time will tweak the recipe.

I just made this for my family and we all loved it! My stepson is the pickiest eater in the world and he actually asked for seconds! The chicken looked great and was super moist. I followed the recipe exactly as written and wouldn't change a thing.
I make this dish quite often as it is definitely a hit at my house. The chicken is extremely tender and tasty, but I would suggest doubling the marinade. Will keep making and enjoying!

This had a subtle, nicely balanced flavor, but only after I fiddled with the marinade a bit. First, I used about half the amount of soy sauce called for. I know how it can permeate delicately flavored chicken and it could potentially have made it too salty as well. Half the amount was the right amount. Second, the type of sesame oil was not specified, and it should be. Does the submitter intend the light, cold-pressed sesame oil used for salads and for frying? Or did she intend the boldly flavored *toasted" sesame oil, used for flavor, usually not more than a dribble in ANY dish? I just used my own judgment, using the light sesame oil for the most part and just a little of the rich, brown, toasted sesame oil for its wonderful flavor. Ginger root is not something I use often so I rarely buy it (and I'm not terribly fond of it anyway). A light pinch of ground ginger sufficed. The honey was a nice addition, giving the chicken a beautiful glazed appearance once it came off the grill. The chicken was tender and moist, but I credit Hubs' expertise with grilling for that! Served with Classic Fried Rice and Easy Bok Choy, this was a delicious, darned near memorable meal, and beautiful in its presentation. (Note: I didn't see heating the marinade ingredients as necessary, so I didn't bother with that step. I just used the easier, more common method of just dumping everything into a Ziploc bag. I marinated the chicken as the submitter recommended, about 15 minutes)
Very very good grilled chicken. Hubby couldn't stop saying how good it was. I did marinate it for about 4 hours but otherwise changed nothing. It was very tender and VERY juicy. A keeper for sure.
I made the marinade in a blender to save time chopping garlic and ginger. My whole family loved it, even the kids!

We used a double recipe for 5 chicken breasts. Used low salt soy and added 1 tsp red pepper flakes and 1 tbsp rice wine vinegar. We used a serving fork to puncture the chicken breasts for better penetration of the marinade. Heated the marinade after boiling for 15-20 minutes to thicken and poured over white rice. It was excellent--we will be using it again
So easy and so delicious with the recipe as is. A great edition to any barbecue. I've used chicken breast and chicken thighs and both worked well.

Fantastic, super tasty and so easy using only 5 ingredients! I used this marinade for mini chicken skewers when we hosted a retirement/65th birthday party. It was a hit with the adults and kids! I cubed all of my chicken and then put in the marinade for almost 24 hours - YUMMY! I will use this one again NO doubt!

I made the entire batch of marinade for two large skinless boneless chicken breast halves. I used about 1 t. of ginger from a tube (found in the produce department) and I ended up putting in another squirt of honey because I thought the soy flavor was a bit overpowering. I didn’t bother heating the marinade, just whisked the ingredients together and poured most of it over the chicken. I reserved some for Hubs to baste on while grilling. I marinated this in the refrigerator for about 4 hours. The chicken came off the grill looking beautiful, with wonderful grill marks. The taste, however, was disappointing after all the rave reviews. This was ok, but I’m sorry to say we weren’t wowed by it at all.
Awesome!
this was pretty good marinade, maybe a little too salty for my taste, next time i might use low sodium soy sauce.
Wonderful recipe, sweet but not overly sweet. The chicken is good marinated for 15 minutes but would be even better marinated for longer. Will definitely make again!

This was tasty. We marinated the chicken for 24 hours, and after that the marinade sort of "broke" apart so that it wasn't suitable to do anything with, so I can't be 100% sure what it would have tasted like with the basting sauce. Thanks for sharing!

Very nice marinade! I used low sodium soy sauce, 1 tsp. of fresh minced ginger, 1 tsp. fresh chopped garlic. I didn't cook the marinade like the recipe called for. I marinaded the chicken for about an hour before throwing it on the grill. Would definitely make it again!

simply perfect. i did marinade w/soy, oil & garlic for 2 -3 hrs before grilling. Made 2x marinade, used some to baste. Served w/fresh clean baby spinach on a plate, put hot cooked brown rice in center then top w/chicken breasts, pour hot sauce over. garnish w/orange or berries. lovely!
Quick marinate and excellent flavor!!

It needs something, but on its own it tastes pretty good. 
I did it in the oven for about 30 minutes or so on 350. I doubled the recipe when I did this so the juice covered the chicken. yum yum. served with rice
Great marinade. I just used minced garlic and still turned out perfect. I had little chicken tenders for this recipe, used 6 tenders for 4 servings (like the recipe calls for). Really good.
Easy to prepare & everyone loved!
This was good, but I would DEFINITELY use low sodium soy sauce. The salt overwhelmed the rest of the flavors.
Great recipe. I doubled the sauce (which wasn't really necessary) and broiled the chicken for about 30 minutes. Great flavor.
